byline.contributor: Binyamin Appelbaum, Neil Gough and David Jolly contributed reporting.

abstract: United States stock market rallies, bolstered by Federal Reserve Bank of New York president William C Dudley's reassurance that interest rates are unlikely to rise; announcement contains promise of continued cheap money that has boosted markets, though some experts say September rate increase could prove stabilizing and beneficial.
lead_paragraph: A Federal Reserve official suggested that September might be too soon to raise interest rates, and investors seemed to react by buying up stocks.

headline.main: Soothing Talk by Federal Reserve Official Buoys Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Soothing Talk by Fed Official Buoys Wall St.

snippet: A Federal Reserve official suggested that September might be too soon to raise interest rates, and investors seemed to react by buying up stocks.

keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
